title: Meghan Markle Just Revealed Archie's Nickname Is "Bubba" and Joked That He Likes to Flirt
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Meghan Markle revealed she and Prince Harry call Archie "Bubba" and joked that Archie likes to flirt.

Archie also danced a little when he met Archbishop Desmond Tutu.

The Sussex family is touring South Africa as part of their first international tour together.

Sorry if you're already exhausted from all the fawning over baby Archie Harrison, but Meghan Markle and Prince Harry just revealed his nickname and it's literally the cutest ever. On top of that, he did a little dance while meeting Archbishop Desmond Tutu that is simply too pure for this world. Honestly, everyone's heart will grow three sizes after seeing the latest Archie content their tour through South Africa has to offer.

Earlier today, Meghan and Harry took their son, Archie, to visit the human rights activist and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe. Just a casual Wednesday for the 5-month-old royal! While they were there, the Sussex Royal Instagram account posted an Insta Story, and Meghan was overheard calling Archie "Bubba," his adorable nickname. Later, when introducing him to the Archbishop and his daughter, People reported that Meghan told Archie, “Say hello! Hello, hi!" When he started to drool, she laughed and said, "Oh, Bubba!”

Okay, now prepare for cuteness overload: When they all gathered in a room, Archie gave the Archbishop a high-five, and when Meghan lifted Archie up in the air, he wiggled his little body and did little dance.

At another point, Archie giggled when Thandeka laughed, so Meghan asked him, "Is that funny?” And when Harry said, "I think he knows exactly what’s going on," Thandeka joked and said, "You like me best, yes! Oh, you like the ladies better, yeah.”

Meghan responded, "He likes to flirt," and now I'm officially melted into a puddle.

Photo credit: Pool/Samir Hussein - Getty Images More

Meghan and Harry's tour will last for a total of 10 days, so get excited for the next time Archie steps out with his parental unit.
